title: Timezone for DateTime Display
description: IANA timezone identifier for datetime display. Controls how UTC timestamps are converted for display to users. Storage is always in UTC to prevent ambiguity. Common timezones: UTC, America/New_York (EST/EDT), Europe/London (GMT/BST), Asia/Tokyo (JST).

x-specs.title: Display datetime in specified timezone
x-specs.then: the datetime is displayed as '2024-12-31 10:00' (EST, UTC-5)

x-specs.title: Reject invalid timezone identifier
x-specs.then: validation error is returned with message 'Invalid IANA timezone identifier'

x-specs.title: Handle DST transition correctly
x-specs.when: user views datetime during DST transition (March/November)
x-specs.then: the datetime is displayed with correct offset (EST -5 or EDT -4)

x-specs.title: Use UTC as default timezone
x-specs.given: a datetime field without timezone property
x-specs.then: the datetime is displayed in UTC timezone (no conversion)
